category.text: $course$/eur-inferential_statistics-204-en-moodle/Inferential Statistics/Confidence Intervals/Margin of error, Inferential Statistics/Confidence Intervals/Width

questiontext.text: Calculate the 95% Confidence Interval of a student who has a grade of 5.2 given a reliability of .31 for the exam. The variance of the grades is 4 Formula for the 95% confidence interval: \(95\% CI = X_o ± Z_{p=95} \times se_m\) Formula for standard error of measurement is: \(se_m = s_o \times \sqrt{1 - R_{xx}}\)

generalfeedback.text:
You will need the formula for the 95% confidence interval: \(95\% CI = X_o ± Z_{p=95} \times se_m\)

\(95\% CI = 5.2 ± 1.96 \times se_m\)

\(se_m = 2 \times \sqrt {1-.31} = 1.662\)

\(95\% CI = 5.2 ± 1.96 \times 1.662 = 5.2 ± 3.26\)

The 95% CI of grade 5.2 is \([1.94-8.46]\)
